titleStmt.title: Thomas S. Turner to James F. Robinson
CWG8889

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Mt. Sterling Ky
13th June 1863
Hon Jas H. Robinson
Dear Govenor

At the present June term of our circuit court Jno M Stephens a worthy loyal & good citizen was fined $25 for standing a stallion without license he confessed Judgt -- It appeared that Mr Stephens did not intend to evade the revenue laws of which I am satisfied -- He directed an agent to pay for license & his agent forgot or omitted it. As Judgt was confessed you can remit three fourths of it -- Be so kind as to do so -- By prompt attention to this you will confer a personal favour on me. If you think bet to remit it enclose remitten to me I am with sentiments of high regard

Fine remitted send to Mrs. Turner
J F Robinson

Montgomery Cir. Ct
$25
Jno. M Stephens
Issd June 16. 1863 --
